version_description:
You asked, we listened! This update makes it easier than ever to find the information you need, when you need it. Here's what we've done:

• Added a navigation bar at the bottom of your screen that allows you to quickly jump to whatever you need (iPhone only).
• Enhanced your itinerary with a new timeline layout that shows you where you are within your trip and what’s coming up next (iPhone only).
• Included a new layover summary that shows how much time you have in between flights (iPhone only).
• Made it easier for TripIt Pro users to tell if their flight is on time, delayed or canceled with color-coded flight information.
• Added a floating action button that allows you to quickly add or edit your travel plans (iPhone only).

This is the latest update in a series of enhancements we’re making this year to make sure that TripIt remains the app you know and love. Stay tuned for more!

In this update we've made some changes to provide a more seamless user experience on your iPhone. Here's what you'll notice:

• New and improved sharing capabilities. Now simply select the plans you want to share and send them through your favorite apps, such as WhatsApp, Slack, and more.
• The ability to merge trips from the app, for those times when plans accidentally get placed into separate trips.

We've also added a native help center to make it simpler to browse help topics and contact our support team from your iPhone and iPad.

In this update we've made TripIt compatible with iOS 10, and added the following enhancements:
• It is even easier to share your travel plans with TripIt for iMessage. Plans can be shared with anyone directly from the Messages app, so it's easy to keep your family, friends, and coworkers updated on your travel plans.
• For our TripIt Pro users, we've also upgraded your flight alerts to rich notifications - adding an expanded summary view and the ability to react to the alert directly from the notification.

We've added helpful new features, like a smart tip when we notice you're missing accommodations for your trip, with a link to search for a hotel through Hipmunk (select trips, iPhone only). With this update you can also:
• Get from point A to point B more easily with enhanced transportation search tools (iPhone only).
• Find the most important flight info faster with our redesigned flight screen, and enjoy refreshed screens for other travel plans (iPhone only).
• Merge multiple TripIt accounts from the app.

Introducing TripIt Pro's newest feature: Go Now tells you when you should leave for the airport (U.S. flights, iPhone only). Also new in this release:
• Smart tips will remind you when your trip is missing a flight (iPhone only).
• Navigator is available for more of your travel plans, so it is easier to get from point A to point B (iPhone only).
• Did you use a different email when booking with a travel supplier? Now you can add and manage email addresses within the app before forwarding confirmations to plans@tripit.com.
• We fixed some bugs that affected parking times, moving plans, and deleting items, and another bug with lodging and car rental dates in the TripIt app for iMessage.

TripIt's new Nearby Places makes it easy to find places around your hotel such as restaurants, cafes, ATMs, bars, and convenience stores (iPhone only). Also in this release:
• A new TripIt Pro alert that will remind you of your terminal and gate number when you're close to the airport (iPhone only).
• TripIt's Facebook camera effects—a fun new way to share your travels with family and friends (iPhone only).
• Rail plans in the Widget, in addition to your flights, lodging, and rental cars.
• Fixes for bugs that affected 3D Touch, profile editing, and more.

In this release, we made the TripIt app compatible with iOS 11 and enhanced TripIt for iMessage to include dynamic updates for shared plans and the ability to share your entire trip. For TripIt Pro users, shared flights will include the most up-to-date information. If the recipient has the TripIt app, the shared trip content will update with any changes that may occur, such as flight delays.

Also in this release:
• Now with iOS 11, you can sign in quickly using password autofill from your iCloud keychain.
• Preview your trip summary from the trip list or get a glimpse at a plan from the trip summary screen with 3D Touch (iPhone only).
• Edit your plans easily: Start typing, and we'll provide location suggestions and fill in the address (iPhone only).
• Nearby Places is now available on the rental car, activity, and restaurant screens (iPhone only).
• Catch potential conflicting plans with new callouts (iPhone only).
• We fixed a bug that caused Go Now to freeze and a few other issues.

iPad owners, rejoice! We've revamped our iPad app with a new look for your trips and plans. The iPad also gets the recent features we introduced for iPhone, such as Nearby Places and more ways to share and, for TripIt Pro users, Go Now, interactive airport maps, and more.

Plus you can use iOS 11's new drag-and-drop feature with the TripIt app for iPad. Need to add a plan to your trip? Simply drag an item from Calendar, Maps, Safari, Contacts, and Photos—and drop it into your timeline.

But that's not all, we've also:
• Made it possible to find your trip information in Spotlight search, allowing you to search upcoming and past trips from your device's home screen.
• (TripIt Pro only) Enhanced our interactive airport maps with:
° Gate-to-gate walk time estimates on layovers.
° Navigation from the gate to the airport’s designated rideshare pickup area (limited airports).
• Added support for layovers of up to 24 hours for our international flyers.
• Fixed bugs that caused crashes when sharing plans and resolving a flight conflict.

With version 10.2, TripIt Pro subscribers now get airport security wait times.
• We monitor security checkpoint lines and let you know how long the wait is for the checkpoints near your gate.
• This feature is currently available at Austin (AUS), Denver (DEN), Orlando (MCO), and Phoenix (PHX) airports.

Easily update your trip with more plans using redesigned screens for adding flights, hotels, car rentals, restaurants reservations, meetings and other activities, and more!

We fixed a bug that affected editing trip information and a crash that happened when long-pressing a location.

• Move an unfiled item into a past or current trip as a plan, and we'll help you fill in any missing information by suggesting locations and addresses as you type.
• We made it easier for you to add or edit car rental, rail, and cruise information. You can also flag some plans that you have not yet booked.
• We fixed lots of bugs, including one when adding a loyalty program to Point Tracker, one with merging trips, and various other plan editing bugs.

We are excited to announce two new features in this release! With TripIt Pro, international travel is easier with access to new tools, including embassy info, currency converters, socket and plug requirements, tipping advice, and more. Plus, all TripIt users will now see safety scores for the neighborhoods they’re visiting. The scores are based on a variety of factors, such as women’s safety, access to health and medical services, and prevalence of theft.

Also new in this release:
• We made it easier to see who you’ve shared your trip with, and to manage the travelers and viewers on your trip.
• We fixed a few bugs including one that affected the trip name when two trips got merged.

With TripIt’s shortcuts for Siri you can quickly get details on your upcoming flight and other travel plans simply by asking Siri. Make sure to upgrade your device to iOS 12 to take advantage of this latest feature. Also new in this release:
• You can view your travel stats in the app! See your distance traveled, trips taken, countries visited, and more, all from the More tab.
• The TripIt app for Apple Watch includes your train reservations and activities such as meetings, tours, and concerts.
• The TripIt widget shows more than just the current day of your itinerary.
• Our assistive technology was enhanced to make your itinerary more comprehensible when using a screen reader.
• We fixed a bug that duplicated flights and another that didn’t take into account your phone’s 24-hour clock settings.

• Canceled travel plans? Forward cancellation emails for a flight, hotel, or car rental to plans@tripit.com to easily remove the reservation from your itinerary.
• New TripIt shortcuts for Siri let you ask for information about your gate and terminal, connecting flight, accommodations, and for TripIt Pro users, baggage claim details.
• You can add TripIt to the Dock on your Watch for quick access to your travel plans.
• We improved VoiceOver support to increase accessibility.
• We fixed a bug that caused some phone numbers to not be included in hotel or ground transportation reservations on the Watch.

• The beloved map view is back and better than ever on both iPhone and iPad. Access it from your trip timeline by tapping the map button to see your travel plans as points on a map. You can also get transportation options for getting from point A to B.
• Have you been using TripIt for years? Now you can view your travel stats by year, in addition to your cumulative total. If your distance traveled is zero, make sure to add a home location and home airport to your profile.
• We redesigned the header for better legibility to support accessibility.
• When you hop in your ride to a meeting or concert, sometimes you need the location name more than the address: Activities on the Watch now include the location name.
• The app is compatible with the new, larger iPhone XS Max and iPhone XR screens.
• We fixed bugs that prevented moving trip items, stopped the Watch app from launching, and more.

Racing in and out of Indianapolis? TripIt Pro users can now get security wait times for IND airport.
Light was peeking out in some places in dark mode, so we plugged those gaps. Upgrade to iOS 13 to check out dark mode.
We fixed a bug where you couldn’t select a country when accessing International Travel Tools from the Pro tab. If you aren’t a subscriber already, get TripIt Pro for useful information about countries you’ll be visiting, such as currency conversion, socket and plug diagrams, embassy locations, tipping etiquette, and more.
We also squished a few other annoying bugs.

• Our most frequently requested feature has arrived! With Documents in TripIt, you can upload PDFs, photos, boarding pass and digital passport QR codes, and more to your travel plans, so everything is in one place. Free TripIt users can upload up to 3 documents per trip, and TripIt Pro users can upload up to 25 documents per trip.
• Everyone has a different comfort level when they travel. Now, you can set a personal risk level with the Neighborhood Safety Scores feature, and we’ll warn you if you’re planning on visiting an area that’s above your threshold. To set your personal risk level, go to More > Profile > Safety.
• Is your TripIt account connected to SAP Concur? Business trips shared with SAP Concur will now be clearly labeled with Shared with SAP Concur. Sharing the trip will help get your expense report started, creating a reminder in Concur Expense. To mark trips as personal, edit the trip in the app and turn off the Share with SAP Concur toggle.
• If you’re new to iOS 14, add the TripIt widget to your home screen to view upcoming travel plans at a glance.

• We made some exciting updates to Interactive Airport Maps for TripIt Pro. • We refreshed the Personal Information screen under your Profile. Make sure to add your home city so we can calculate your travel stats.
• We made some improvements to search suggestions when using VoiceOver.
• We fixed a bug associated with accessing the Help Center. Go there for how-to articles and to contact customer support.

• We’ve refreshed the screens for your travel plans—car rental, train, lodging, and more—to make them quicker to skim. Plus, it’s easier to access Neighborhood Safety Scores from your lodging, restaurant, and meeting plans, so you can be better prepared when you arrive.
• The flight detail screen has a new layout, including more convenient access to airport maps. With TripIt Pro, Interactive Airport Maps will help you get around easily with step-by-step directions, walking times, search options, and more.
